http://www.islam.tc/ask-imam/view.php?q=6930 refers.

There Was This Similar Sort of Confusion About Modern Media & Technology With the Use of Microphones and Speaker Systems in Masjids Where People Were Thought To be Following a Voice on the Speaker and Not the Imam During Sallah. If You Say Television Visuals Fall into This Category Then The Point Made Above Where Life Itself is Moving Images With a Human Capable of Capturing 13 of Them a Second is My Argment Against it.

Muhtaram Brother/Sister in Islam

Assalamualikum Warahmatullahi Wabarakatuhu

 

Your questionnaire raises several issues: 

1)Creating images of animate objects.

2)Capturing real life events using a camera and presenting it on screen.

3)Using smileys on cell phone chat applications.

4)Viewing television.

5)Using television as a weapon to combat the media.

6)Viewing Islamic educational programmes on television

 

1) Creating image's of animate objects,be it drawing on paper,sewing,threading or capturing pictures via camera is impermissible.

 

2)Capturing real life events on video camera and presenting them on screen is also impermissible as these images are actually being drawn and vanish very rapidly when portrayed on screen,therefore causing a moving effect.(Refer to book "Introduction To Photography")

 

3)Using smileys on cell phone chat applications is permissible as these smileys are diminutive.(smaller than the tip of ones finger).Such diminutive images are allowed in the shari'ah.(Raddul Muhtaar)

 

4)Viewing television is not permissible under any circumstance.The argument you present is illogical and flimsy.

 

5)The concept of "using television as a weapon to combat the media,hence it should be permissible out of necessity" is incorrect.One should steer clear of anything involving picture making as the warnings mentioned in the hadith are quit stern.It is not befitting of a Mumin (Believer) to soil his hands in anything that involves picture making,moreso the television which contains insurmountable filth and immodest ideas.

Unfortunately some scholars have erred in this regard and have permitted using television to combat the media based on necessity.We are compelled to state that the Deen of Allah is not in need of such filth to be promoted.Had the deen of Allah been in need to be promoted via television,Nabi Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam would not have prohibited picture making or mentioned such stern warnings regarding it,as whatever Nabi Sallallahu Alaihi Wa Sallam said or did was actually from the side of Allah and Allah,s knowledge encompasses everything from creation till Doomsday and beyond that.

 

6)Viewing television for Islamic/Educational purposes is also impermissible.While modern technology for knowledge is indeed a gift from Allah Ta'ala,Islamic knowledge should be sought from its pure sources which are free from those things which Allah has ordained Haraam.Using the television is definitely not the way to gain Islamic knowledge as it contains a great amount of filth and vices.Also these so called "Islamic" programmes host non mahram females as well as music.Your claim that you have learnt more from the television than you have learnt from 10 years in the madrasah gives the hint that you did not spend your time correctly in the madrasah.

 

7)A person who is of the opinion thattelevision is Halaal is in total misguidance and is committing a heinous sin.However he will not fall out of the fold of islam.Television in no way falls under the category of doubtful.It is clearly impermissible.

 

8)It is not permissible to view images which are not permissible to create/capture.Hence both creator and viewer will be sinful.(Ahkaam e Tasweer,Mufti Muhammad Shafee)

 

And Allah Ta'ala knows best.

 

Moulana Suhail Tar Mohammed

 

Student: Darul Ifta

A SPECIAL MESSAGE FROM MUFTI EBRAHIM DESAI

 

 

When the world was in darkness of inhumanity, Allah Taala gave knowledge and guidance to Rasulullah (Sallalahu Alayhi Wasallam).
The guidance through that Divine knowledge had changed the mindset of people and transformed the evil practices of people to the highest morals.
Education and knowledge of Divine guidance is the backbone and foundation of reformation, prosperity and peace.
Islam provides guidance and solution for every aspect of life. Ignorance of such knowledge leads one to look down upon Islam and suffer an inferiority complex.
When one studies Islam, the Quran and Hadith, then only one will value the in-depth wisdom in such knowledge.
Muslims are generally ignorant about Islam and that is the fundamental cause of our decline and retrogression.
We have to educate ourselves on Islam and rise to the challenges of the times and once again prove ourselves as a dynamic Ummah. For that sacrifice, take out time to study Islam from reliable Ulama and scholars.
If you cannot make your son an Aalim of Deen then encourage others to become Huffaz and Ulama. You will get the reward of the person studying and guiding people through his knowledge.
If that too is difficult, at least help and assist a person who wishes to study Deen.
Rasulullah (Sallalahu Alayhi Wasallam) said, “When a person passes away all his deeds terminate except three, Sadaqah e Jaariyya (perpetual reward), pious child that makes Dua for the parents and knowledge through which others benefit”.
